detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
This method adds watchers which are used for debugging to look at data associated with this Cell App Manager.

inbodydescription.para: This adds a health check watcher to display a decaying average of largest timeout from the known CellApps.

detaileddescription.para: This method initiates a controlled shutdown of the system.
This method creates a new entity on the system. It finds the appropriate cell to create the entity on and does so.

xrefdescription.para: Currently adds the entity to the first space but the correct space will need to be specified in the message.

detaileddescription.para: This method creates a new entity on the system. It finds the appropriate cell to create the entity on and does so.
This private method is used by createEntity and createSpace to implement their common functionality.
This method handles a message from the database to restore spaces that have been previously saved.
This method handles clusterID from BaseAppMgr.
This method tells us to start.
This method shuts down this application.
This method is called to shut down the CellAppMgr application.
This method handles a message to start shutting down in a controlled way.
This method triggers a controlled shutdown of the cluster.
This method enables or disables offloading of entities on all cells.
This method adds a Cell Application to the list of known cell applications.
This method removes a Cell Application from the list of known cell applications.
This method lets the CellAppMgr know about a CellApp when it is recovering.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr to inform us of the address of a base application.
This method is called to inform the Cell App Manager that another Cell App Manager has been started.
This method is called to inform the Cell App Manager that a new Base App Manager has been started.
This method is called to inform the Cell App Manager that a Cell App has died unexpectedly.
This method is called from a CellApp that has received and processed a handleCellAppDeath message.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr informing us that a BaseApp has died. All the CellApps will now be informed.
This method handles when a DBAppMgr has started.
This method handles DBAppMgr telling us where the DBApp Alpha is.

This method handles a message to set a shared data value. This may be data that is shared between all CellApps or all CellApps and BaseApps. The CellAppMgr is the authoritative copy of this information.

This method handles a message to delete a shared data value. This may be data that is shared between all CellApps or all CellApps and BaseApps. The CellAppMgr is the authoritative copy of this information.
This method handles a message for adding a service fragment.
This method handles a message for deleting a service fragment.
This method handles a message from a cell to update space property.
This method handles a message from a cell to write the space to database.
This method handles a message from a cell to update space geometry mappings.
This method handles a message from a cell to update space geometry mappings.
This method handles a message from a cell to update space load bounds.
This method handles a message from a cell to update space load bounds.
This method handles a message from a cell for start recording.
This method handles a message from a cell for stop recording.
This method handles a message informing us to shut down a space.
This method is called to acknowledge that the base apps are in a particular shutdown stage.
This request is called to query the status of this process.
This message handles someone telling us what their game time is and asking for our version of it, since we are the time master (hmmm time lord?)
This method is used to identify when all components are ready.
This method finds the space with the input id. If none is found, NULL is returned. If we ask for the default space and it hasn't been created yet, it will be created here.
This method finds the cell application with the input address. If no application is found, NULL is returned.
This method returns a CellApp that is not the input one.
Watcher helper method for numActiveCellApps(cellApps that has > 0 cells)
Watcher helper method for numCells
This method returns the number of entities that the Cell App Manager thinks are in the system.
This method returns the minimum load on the active cell apps.
This method returns the average load on the active cell apps.
This method returns the average load on the active cell apps.
This method returns the number of cells in the biggest space.
This method returns the average number of cells per space. It only takes multi-cell spaces into account.
This method returns the number of cell partitions among all spaces.
Thie method returns a string representation of the CellApp groups with multiple CellApps.
This method returns the number of multi-cell spaces.
This method returns the number of spaces that have CellApps on multiple physical machines.
This method returns the average number of distinct physical machines over which a space's cells are spread. It only takes multi-cell spaces into consideration.
This method returns the maximum number of distinct physical machines over which a space's cells are spread. It only takes multi-cell spaces into consideration.
This method returns the number of splits of all spaces over multiple machines. For example, a space that has cells on CellApps over three unique physical machines will have two machine partitions.
This method clears the death handler associated with the input address.
This method writes space information to the database.
This method writes the game time to the database.
Predicate that returns the number of spaces in which have loaded their respective mapped geometry.
The initialisation method.
This method is used to initialise the script associated with this application.
This method starts the timer.

This method handles a cell application dying unexpectedly. The address arg to this method is deliberately not a reference because the CellApp object can be deleted halfway through this, taking its channel and address with it.
This method is called periodically to check whether or not any cell applications have timed out.
This method sets the Cell App Manager to be in recovery mode. In this time, currently running cell apps should inform us about their details.
This method is called at the end of recovery.
This method synchronizes space geometry mappings after recovery.
This method synchronizes space artificial min load after recovery.
This method synchronizes space data after recovery.
This method synchronizes space recording session after recovery.
This method checks whether there needs to be any migration of spaces between cell applications. If so, it will take action.
This method performs load balancing on each of the spaces.
This method performs load balancing on each of the spaces.
This method checks whether there are any spaces that are loading geometry that could benefit from more loading cells.
This method checks if we should report the CellApps as overloaded.

memberdef.argsstring: (bool areCellAppsOverloaded, uint64 tolerancePeriodInStamps, uint64 &overloadStartTime, const char *warningMsg)
memberdef.name: calculateOverload

detaileddescription.para: This method checks if CellApps overload exceeds tolerance period.

This method generates space ID or checks validity of the passed space ID
spaceID
space ID to use
This method adds a new space to the system.
This method responds to timeout events.

An object of this type is the main object for the Cell App Manager application. It is used to manage the Cell Apps that are running on the server. It is responsible for maintaining the cells and the spaces and making sure the the Cell Apps are balanced.
